poem:
**Corrections**

How delicate,
this web of facts and places.
Magdeburg now replaces Halle 
in my atlas of error.
Noel Edmonds, not on that 
first Top Gear,
drives the winding path
of memory.
And somewhere,
in the margins of Europe,
rights are written, rewritten,
as we sip coffee,
correct the small notes 
of our days.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
